etymologies: late Middle English: from Old English sticel ‘thorn, sting’ + bæc ‘back’

definitions: a small fish with sharp spines along its back, able to live in both salt and fresh water and found in both Eurasia and North America.

notes.text: Family Gasterosteidae: several genera and species, including the common and widespread three-spined stickleback (Gasterosteus aculeatus)

shortDefinitions: small fish with sharp spines along its back
